newsitem.title: USA: Shelter Components expects Q4 gain on sale.
newsitem.headline: Shelter Components expects Q4 gain on sale.

text.p: Shelter Components Corp said it expects reporting a 1996 fourth-quarter gain on the sale of its Danube Carpet Mills Inc business to Dixie Yarns Inc.

The sale, effective December 31, was for about $25 million, consisting of $18.2 million in cash, $4.4 million in accounts receivable retained by Shelter and $2.4 million deferred for certain real estate not yet conveyed to Dixie.

Shelter said the revenues of Danube Carpet Mills, based in Fort Oglethorpe, Ga., were about $75 million in 1996 and represent about 15 percent of Shelter's consolidated net sales, which are anticipated to surpass $500 million in calendar year 1996.
Shelter distributes hardware, fasteners, building products, vinyl windows, floor coverings and electrical products, among others.
